address.description: A pattern to collect a Canadian address, including fields for address, city, province, and postal code.
address.label: Address
address.title: Address

attestation.description: A set of conditions that must be confirmed. For example, to ensure a legal responsibility is understood.
attestation.title: Attestation

checkbox.description: A set of options for multiple selections.
checkbox.title: Checkboxes

combobox.description: A searchable list of options for single selection.
combobox.title: Searchable list
combobox.selectOne: Start typing to narrow down the list.

contact.description: A pattern to collect information for follow-up communication, including phone number, email, and language of correspondence.
contact.label: Contact
contact.title: Contact

date.description: A field to collect the date in a predictable format.
date.title: Date

departments.description: A managed list of Government of Canada organizations for single selection.
departments.title: Department
departments.selectOne: Start typing to narrow down the list.

dropdown.description: A long list of options for single selection.
dropdown.title: Dropdown

dynamicRow.description: The option to add a series of related answers to a question and repeat the set multiple times.
dynamicRow.title: Repeating set

fileInput.description: A way to add supporting documentation.
fileInput.label: Add file
fileInput.title: File upload

firstMiddleLastName.description: Separate fields for first, middle, and last names. This follows a conventional format that might be needed to process forms.
firstMiddleLastName.label: Individual names
firstMiddleLastName.title: Individual names

name.description: A single field for name. This can be a more inclusive and sensitive way to collect this information.
name.label: Full name
name.title: Full name

number.description: A field that only accepts a numeric value.
number.title: Number

radio.description: A small set of options for single selection.
radio.title: Radio buttons

richText.description: A rich text element for inserting headings, paragraph text, lists, or links.
richText.example: Paragraph text that can be formatted in bold or italics, or with hyperlinks.
richText.title: Page text

textField.description: A text input for a single-line answer.
textField.title: Short answer

textArea.title: Long answer
textArea.description: A text area for a multi-line freeform answer.

autocompleteOptions.address-line1: Address line 1 (civic number and street name)
autocompleteOptions.name: Full name (includes first, middle, and last names)

autocompleteWhenNotToUse.text1: Auto complete attributes may not work well for information the form filler does not enter regularly. Things like historical or business information may not fill in correctly.
autocompleteWhenNotToUse.text2: Usability testing is a good way to understand if the rules you set cause problems with filling in forms.
autocompleteWhenNotToUse.title: When not to use autocomplete

branding.heading: Branding
branding.notFound: Didn’t find your department or agency in the list?
branding.select: Select different branding for the top of your form
branding.text1: Published forms include the Government of Canada signature by default.

characterLimitDescription: Only use a character limit when there is a good reason for limiting the number of characters users can enter.

characterLimitWhenToUse.text1: Evidence that users are likely to enter more information than they need to.
characterLimitWhenToUse.text2: A legal or technical reason that means an entry must be no more than a certain number of characters.
characterLimitWhenToUse.text3: If your users keep hitting the character limit imposed by the backend of your service then try to increase the limit rather than use a character count.
characterLimitWhenToUse.title: Reasons for using a character limit

confirmationDescriptionItem1: details of what happens next and when.
confirmationDescriptionItem3: links to information or services that users are likely to need next.
confirmationDescriptionItem4: a link to your feedback form. (if you don’t have one, you can set one up using GC Forms to be launched along with your main form).
confirmationDescriptionParagraph: The confirmation message will appear on a new page once the form has been submitted. Some useful things you can add to your confirmation page are:
contactSupportIfYouHaveQuestions: Contact support if you have any questions.

descriptionDescription: The hint text appears below the label and before the field. It’s used to add context and instructions for the field. It’s a great place to specify formatting requirements or give an example.

formDeleteResponses.message4: 2. Confirm the receipt of downloaded responses by signing off on their removal from GC Forms.

draft.message1: Deleting a form cannot be undone. Your form will be removed from your forms list.
draft.message2: Download a copy of this form for your records. The saved JSON form file can be uploaded again to create a new form later.

published.message1: Deleting a form cannot be undone. Your form will be removed from your forms list and the Internet.
published.message2: Download a copy of this form for your records. The saved JSON form file can be uploaded again to create a new form later.
published.message3: The URL of your form will change if you upload your form again.

formDeletedResponsesExist: The form could not be deleted. Ensure there are no new responses and try again.

formDownload.btnText: What can I do with a form file?

formSubmissionDisabledInPreview: Form submission is disabled in preview
ifYouAreExperiencingProblems: If you are experiencing any problems with your published form, please contact support.

maxNumberOfRows.description: Users can provide up to this many entries for this question.
maxNumberOfRows.label: Maximum number of answers

previewDisabledForPublishedForm: Preview and testing is disabled for published forms.
privacyNoticeDescription:
Help people filling out the form understand how you’re handling their personal information, as outlined in Section 4.2.10 of the Directive on privacy practices.

What to include in a privacy notice

  • What personal information is being collected and why.
  • What legal or program authorities you have to collect information.
  • How their information will be used, shared, stored, and retained.
  • How people can access or change their personal information and file complaints.

You’re responsible for understanding your department or agency's responsibilities related to personal information. If you’re unsure how to proceed, we recommend contacting your access to information and privacy coordinator.
publishedViewLinks: View and share your published form with these links:
publishingDisablesEditingDescription: Once you publish, you cannot make changes to this form. If changes are needed after publishing, use the form file to create and publish a new form.
publishingLocksSettingsDescription: The response delivery option you choose will no longer be changeable.
publishingRemovesTestResponsesDescriptio: Any prior responses will be removed from the system.

responseDeliveryHelp.title: Choosing a response delivery option
responseDeliveryHelp.description: There are two options for getting submitted form responses. Use the chart below to help pick which option best fits your needs.

inbox.text1: For up to PROTECTED A forms
inbox.text2: Responses are delivered directly to an inbox in real time

share.seePreview: See a preview of the email message

share.stepOneDetails: Save the attached JSON form file to your computer
share.stepTwoDetails: Go to GC Forms. No account needed.
share.stepTwoDetailsNoHTML: Go to GC Forms (https://forms-formulaires.alpha.canada.ca/). No account needed.
share.title: Share

unauthenticated.description: You cannot share a form directly from GC Forms without an account. Sign in or create an account to get access to this feature and more.
unauthenticated.instructions: You can download a copy of this form file to your computer and share it through your email.
unauthenticated.step1Details: Download a copy of your form as a JSON form file to your computer
unauthenticated.step2Details: Copy and paste the email instructions into an email and attach the form file

title: Title

departmentElement.title: Where the list of GC organizations comes from?
departmentElement.body: GC Forms uses a list of departments and agencies maintained by the Canadian Digital Service. Your form will automatically update with this list.

translateDescription: Translate your form content side by side to provide a bilingual experience to those filling out your form.
unlockPublishingDescription: To unlock publishing, provide the contact information of the person you report to.

nagware.restrictedDownloadAfter35Days: Downloading will be restricted if overdue responses are older than 35 days.

body2.moreThan20Responses: new responses older than 21 days. Download and sign off on the removal of 20 overdue new responses at a time.
body2.lessThan20Responses: new responses older than 21 days. Download and sign off on the removal of all overdue new responses.

unconfirmedSubmissionsOver21DaysOld.title: Sign off on the removal of responses from GC Forms
unconfirmedSubmissionsOver21DaysOld.body2: downloaded responses older than 21 days. Confirm receipt of all overdue responses by signing off on their removal from GC Forms.

unsavedSubmissionsOver35DaysOld.title: Downloading is restricted to overdue responses until they are retrieved

body2.moreThan20Responses: new responses over 35 days old. Download and sign off on 20 overdue responses at a time before continuing.
body2.lessThan20Responses: new responses over 35 days old. Download and sign off on all overdue responses before continuing.

unconfirmedSubmissionsOver35DaysOld.title: Downloading is restricted until responses are signed off for removal
unconfirmedSubmissionsOver35DaysOld.body2: downloaded responses 35 days overdue. Sign off on the removal of all overdue downloaded responses before saving new ones.

vaultNote.text1: PROTECTED B form responses must be downloaded from GC Forms.
vaultNote.text2: Email delivery is not available for this data classification

addConditionalRules.modalTitle: Add a rule to a question
addConditionalRules.modalDescription: Display additional input fields depending on the selection of a specific option. This applies to single choice, multiple choice, or dropdown list questions.

logic.heading: Logic
logic.description: Apply conditional rules to sections with radio buttons, checkboxes, and dropdown form elements.
logic.saveNote: Adding and saving a rule, turns off Auto-flow sections
logic.resetRulesDescription: Auto flow will automatically set a linear flow for your sections, overriding any existing rules.

multiRulesWarning.text1: The flow is currently set based on the rules applied.
multiRulesWarning.text3: To flow sections, you must clear the rules applied to question elements.
